curam.util.transaction

Class TransactionInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.transaction.TransactionInfo

  • public final class TransactionInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains context information about the currently executing business function and its transaction context. This class uses ThreadLocal variables to ensure that each concurrently executing business function in an application server has its own copy of TransactionInfo, returned by the static getInfo method. None of the return values from methods in this class should be stored locally. The method must be invoked each time a value is required.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      Contains the constants returned by TransactionInfo.getTransactionType.

      • getTransactionType

        public static TransactionInfo.TransactionType getTransactionType()
        Get the transaction type of the current transaction. The value returned is equal to one of the constant values contained in the TransactionType class.
        Returns:
        The transaction type.
        See Also:
        TransactionInfo.TransactionType, TransactionInfo.setTransactionType(TransactionInfo.TransactionType)

      • getProgramLocale

        public static java.lang.String getProgramLocale()
        Get the locale of the user currently associated with this transaction. If the locale does not exist, it will be read from the database and set for the transaction. If the user does not exist or no locale is set for the user null will be returned.
        Returns:
        The the locale for this transaction.
        See Also:
        TransactionInfo.setProgramLocale(String)

      • getUserTimeZone

        public static java.util.TimeZone getUserTimeZone()
        Get the current user's time zone from the user preferences. If the time zone returned from the user preferences is not recognized then the time zone will default to the server time zone.
        Returns:
        The current user's time zone from the user preferences or the server time zone if the user's time zone was not recognized.

      • getTimeZoneAdjustedDateTime

        public static DateTime getTimeZoneAdjustedDateTime(Date date)
        Converts a date into a date time. The date time returned is time zone unaware and is stored as the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to be converted to a date time.
        Returns:
        The date time representing the specified date as the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.

        Get the time zone of the server.
        Returns:
        The time zone of the server.

        Returns:
        The program timestamp.
        See Also:
        TransactionInfo.setProgramTimeStamp(long)

        Returns:
        The value of the flag indicating if the SQL query cache is enabled for the transaction.
        See Also:
        TransactionInfo.setSQLQueryCacheEnabled(boolean)

        public static java.lang.Object getFacadeScopeObject(java.lang.Integer objectIdentifier)
        Obtain a reference to an object which has been placed within the scope of a transaction.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A reference to the object. If setFacadeScopeObject has not been called for this identifier in this transaction then null is returned.
        See Also:

      • setFacadeScopeObject

        public static void setFacadeScopeObject(java.lang.Integer objectIdentifier,
                                        java.lang.Object objectHook)
        Associate an object with the current transaction. If an object is associated with the current transaction it is available to all classes which are invoked as part of that transaction. If different objects are associated with the current transaction for the same object identifier then getFacadeScopeObject will return the last one to be associated.
        Parameters:
        objectIdentifier - The identifier of the object that should be associated with the transaction.
        objectHook - The object that should be associated with the transaction.
        See Also:
        TransactionInfo.getFacadeScopeObject(Integer)

      • setFacadeScopeObject

        public static void setFacadeScopeObject(java.lang.String objectIdentifier,
                                        java.lang.Object objectHook)
        Associate an object with the current transaction. If an object is associated with the current transaction it is available to all classes which are invoked as part of that transaction. If different objects are associated with the current transaction for the same object identifier then getFacadeScopeObject will return the last one to be associated.
        Parameters:
        objectIdentifier - The identifier of the object that should be associated with the transaction.
        objectHook - The object that should be associated with the transaction.
        See Also:
        TransactionInfo.getFacadeScopeObject(String)

      • getAlternateLoginIDForUser

        Returns the alternate login ID for the username.
        Parameters:
        userName - The username whose alternate login id, if present, will be returned. If the alternate login ID does not exist, the username passed as parameter will be returned.
        Returns:
        The alternate login ID for the specified username.

      • getInfoConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getInfoConnection()
                                      throws AppRuntimeException
        Get the database connection that has been established for operations. It is the responsibility of the caller to manage all resources that are then associated with this connection. Examples include
        • Prepared Statement Caching.
        • Ensuring PreparedStatements, ResultSets, etc are closed.
        Returns:
        The connection handle.
        Throws:
        AppRuntimeException - The rollback exception.
        See Also:
        TransactionInfo.setInfoConnection(Connection)

      • begin

        public void begin()
           throws AppRuntimeException
        Begin a transaction. Curam does not support nested transactions so begin should not be invoked if a transaction is ongoing. Invocation of this method is also not supported from transactions of type "deferred" (i.e. Workflows, Deferred Processes or any interfaces called from Workflow or Deferred Processes, including callback interfaces such as NotificationDelivery, WorkResolver, DPCallback, etc).
        Throws:
        AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_RUNTIME - the begin failed because of a database/resource manager error
        AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_ERR_BEGIN_NESTED_TRANS - nested transactions are not supported.
        See Also:
        TransactionInfo.commit(), TransactionInfo.rollback()

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws AppRuntimeException
        Commit a transaction. This does not close the connection associated with that transaction. Invocation of this method is also not supported from transactions of type "deferred" (i.e. Workflows, Deferred Processes or any interfaces called from Workflow or Deferred Processes, including callback interfaces such as NotificationDelivery, WorkResolver, DPCallback, etc).
        Throws:
        AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_RUNTIME - the commit failed, perhaps partially if heuristics are used by the resource manager.
        See Also:
        TransactionInfo.begin(), TransactionInfo.rollback()

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
              throws AppRuntimeException
        Rollback a transaction. This does not close the connection associated with that transaction. Invocation of this method is also not supported from transactions of type "deferred" (i.e. Workflows, Deferred Processes or any interfaces called from Workflow or Deferred Processes, including callback interfaces such as NotificationDelivery, WorkResolver, DPCallback, etc).
        Throws:
        AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_RUNTIME - the rollback failed.
        See Also:
        TransactionInfo.begin(), TransactionInfo.rollback()

      • openConnection

        public void openConnection()
                    throws AppRuntimeException
        Open the connection to the database. This can be used to allow the Curam generated data access code to work in an environment where Curam does not control the transaction.
        Throws:
        AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_CANNOT_CONNECT_TO_DATABASE - cannot connect to the database.
        AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_RUNTIME - an unexpected error occurred.

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Close the connection to the database. This can be used to allow the Curam generated data access code to work in an environment where Curam does not control the transaction.

      • getProgramUserType

        public static java.lang.String getProgramUserType()
                                           throws AppException,
                                                  InformationalException
        Get the user type associated with the current transaction.
        Returns:
        The user type.
        Throws:
        AppException - generic exception signature
        InformationalException - generic exception signature

      • getSystemDateTime

        public static DateTime getSystemDateTime()
        Gets the current - or overridden - system DateTime. If the date has been overridden for testing (using the curam.test.date.override application property) then midnight of the beginning of the date specified by this property is returned. Otherwise the system DateTime is returned.
        Returns:
        the current or overridden system DateTime.

      • getBusinessDateTime

        public DateTime getBusinessDateTime()
        Get the Business DateTime which can be either:
      • the business DateTime for the current transaction if specified, otherwise
      • the DateTime returned by the getSystemDateTime() method.
Returns:
The current Business DateTime.

  • getSystemDate

    public static Date getSystemDate()
    Gets the current - or overridden - system Date. If the date has been overridden for testing (using the curam.test.date.override application property) then the date specified by this property is returned. Otherwise the system date is returned.
    Returns:
    the current or overridden system Date.

  • getBusinessDate

    public Date getBusinessDate()
    Get the current Business Date which can be either:
  • the business Date for the current transaction if specified, otherwise
  • the Date component of the result of getBusinessDateTime().
Returns:
The Business Date for the current transaction or the date component of the result of getBusinessDateTime().
See Also:
TransactionInfo.getBusinessDateTime()
